page.title: 19EMPLOYMENT
page.content: Great Witley does not seem to be affected by the national unemployment situation. From the results of a local questionaire all men of working age who completed the form are in work and so are some wives. Approximately 50% of those questioned work locally. About 30% travel a distance of ten miles and 20% travel farther than 20 miles commuting to the industrial Midlands. The predominating jobs seem to be farming and teaching. There are quite a number of retired people living in the residential area of the village in The Glebe where old persons' bungalows have been provided by the council. The majority of inhabitants have lived in the village for twenty years or less, but there are some elderly residents who can remember the time when most people in the village worked at Witley Court.
